description: brain +‎ wash, calque of Chinese 洗腦／洗脑／洗脑／洗脑 (xǐnǎo), literally "to wash the brain". Usage via U.S. military during Korean War.

entries.meaning: A distorting effect upon one's memory, belief, or ideas, as by propaganda.

verbs.description: brainwash (third-person singular simple present brainwashes, present participle brainwashing, simple past and past participle brainwashed)

entries.meaning: (psychology) To affect one's mind by using extreme mental pressure or any other mind-affecting process. (e.g. hypnosis)
(figuratively, dated) To take from an electronically controlled machine its stored-up information; to erase a computer's programming. (1960)

examples: The news media brainwashed many people.
